overallSummary: Fabio Giglietto maintains an active presence across Mastodon, LinkedIn, and Bluesky, focusing primarily on research related to social media analysis, disinformation, and computational social science. Engagement varies across platforms, with LinkedIn showing strong performance due to professional networking, while Bluesky and Mastodon provide avenues for broader academic discussion and announcements.

contentThemes.description: Research announcements, publications, and discussions related to computational methods for social media analysis.
Content focusing on the detection and study of disinformation, coordinated inauthentic behavior, and information operations.
Posts related to hiring, research grants, and opportunities for PhD students and postdoctoral researchers.

recommendations: Diversify content formats to include images, videos, and interactive polls to boost engagement.
Tailor content to the specific audience of each platform. Focus on professional networking on LinkedIn, academic discussions on Mastodon, and emerging trends on Bluesky.
Use relevant hashtags to increase discoverability and reach a wider audience.
Actively participate in conversations and respond to comments to foster a sense of community.

platformInsights.bluesky: Bluesky is effective for disseminating research and attracting PhD students, with relatively high repost rates. Optimize for trending topics.
platformInsights.mastodon: Mastodon serves as a good platform for sharing research updates and engaging with a more academic audience. Engagement is lower than other platforms. Consider posting more thought-provoking questions to encourage discussion.
platformInsights.linkedin: LinkedIn is highly effective for career-related announcements and professional networking, resulting in higher engagement levels. Continue to leverage for funding announcements and job opportunities.
